texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: My daily work involves working with a large number of servers and one of my frustrations with Firefox is that it's not possible to select an entire IP address with a double click with the default settings. Although it works right out of the box with Safari, you have to make a configuration adjustment in Firefox to get the same behavior.
texts.text: My daily work involves working with a large number of servers and one of my frustrations with Firefox is that it's not possible to select an entire IP address with a double click with the default settings. Although it works right out of the box with Safari, you have to make a configuration adjustment in Firefox to get the same behavior.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: To change the setting in Firefox, open up a new Firefox tab and go to
texts.text: To change the setting in Firefox, open up a new Firefox tab and go to

texts.text: in the search bar that appears below your tab bar and double click the

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: line. It should become bold and the value on the end will flip from true to false.
texts.text: line. It should become bold and the value on the end will flip from true to false.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Go back to another tab and  open a web page which displays an IP address . Double click on any portion of the IP address and Firefox should highlight the entire address.
texts.text: Go back to another tab and  open a web page which displays an IP address . Double click on any portion of the IP address and Firefox should highlight the entire address.
